intro: Lecostomon sylvestre, commonly known as the woodland lecostomon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Lecostomon sylvestre is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora in temperate forests.
